page.title: 03Farming and Farms
page.content: Mixed farming economy with relatively large farms. Arable land is mainly improved pasture for dairy and beef herds and cereals like wheat and barley, vegetables especially potatoes and peas. The northerly farms include Downland rough pasture for sheep. Most of these farms include small disused chalk pits. Everywhere there are small mainly deciduous copses. Most farms are run by families. There are 2 nurseries/market gardens; a small one near Yafford, a large one at Northcourt farm. There is a trout farm at Yafford. Except where there are manor estates the farm houses are small, stone-built structures with clay tile roofs but some roofs are slate or even corrugated iron.
